newsitem.title: HONG KONG: New World controlling stake down to 36pct.
newsitem.headline: New World controlling stake down to 36pct.

text.p: The shareholding of the Cheng family's Chow Tai Fook Enterprises Ltd in New World Development Co Ltd will be diluted to about 35.83 percent from 37.35 percent on completion of a share placement and new share subscription, New World said in a statement published on Friday.
Chow Tak Fook, which owned by the Cheng family, is the controlling shareholder of New World.

New World's managing director Henry Cheng said the HK$2.755 billion from the share subscription would be used to finance property development, telecommunications activities and for general corporate purposes.

Chow Tak Fook on Thursday agreed to place 75 million existing New World shares or 4.26 percent of the existing share capital at HK$37.10 per share to global investors and to subscribe for the same amount of new shares at the same price.
Trading in the company's shares, which was suspended in early afternoon trade on Thursday, will resume on Friday.
Its shares were last traded at HK$38.00.
